Argument Functions and Coordinate Functions

Argument functions, when fed with a single xtensors.TensorLike object, return an XTensor instance with integer data representing the indices of the original tensor. An example is xtensors.argmax(), which returns the indices where the maximum values occur.

Similarly, coordinate functions return the coordinates associated with the axes of the original tensor.

xtensors.argmax(x: xtt.TensorLike, /, dim: xtt.DimLike | xtt.DimsLike | None) → XTensor
Returns
